channel.title: JAVA: Need A How-To

item.title: JAVA: Need A How-To
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

IF YOU KNOW WHAT YOU ARE DOING these might be useful.

public boolean hasAny(int ... itemList) { for (int item : itemList) { if (hasItem(item)) return true; } return false; }

public boolean hasAll(int ... itemList) { for (int item : itemList) if (!hasItem(item)) return false; return true; }

Read full topic

item.title: JAVA: Need A How-To
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

[quote=“Docent, post:8, topic:528871”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=647623.msg4355714#msg4355714 date=1377531224]
I would suggest you take a look at Java enumerations. Enum types allow you to utilize constants in the same way as constant integers, but they wrap the functionality in a layer of readability, instead of using magic numbers (which is a bad practice in programming).
[/quote]

Yes, I know. My father told me that using enums are more efficient than numbering things. Thanks[/quote]if your father has any knowledge in the field, why not ask him before making a topic? or perhaps using google?

Read full topic

item.title: JAVA: Need A How-To

item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

hasItem doesn’t accept an array? That’s just silly.

Anyways:

for (int hatchet : VALID_HATCHET) { if (player.getInventory().hasItem(hatchet)) { player.getActionSender().sendMessage("You chop the canoe."); return; } }

item.title: JAVA: Need A How-To
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

Hello, I am working on adding a feature to my private server. I added a constant integer array called VALID_HATCHET, now this constant has around 8 different integers in it. How would I write an “if statement” that asks to see if the player has any of the integers in the array? Thanks.

Visual: (sorta)

public static final int[] VALID_HATCHET = {1351, 1349, 1353, 1355, 1357, 1359, 1361, 6739};

public static void chopCanoeTreeLog(Player player, int x, int y) {
if (player.getInventory().hasItem(??? I NEED HELP HERE ???)) {
player.getActionSender().sendMessage(“You chop the canoe.”);
return;
}
}

Again, thanks

Read full topic
